SENT.plain: A 34-year-old woman with extensive Klippel-Trenaunay syndrome is presented
Clinical and radiological tests demonstrated that three quadrants are affected with haemangiomas, varicose veins and bone abnormalities
In addition, our patient suffers from congenital lymphoedema of both legs
Associated findings such as intestinal haemangiomata, vascular hamartomas, lipoma or arteriovenous abnormalities of the spinal cord were not apparent
The treatment is only symptomatic with compression bandages and an orthopaedic appliance for compensation of the different leg length
